Segar, Sir William (b. in or before 1564, d.1633

As Elizabeth Goldring has shown, in addition to being a herald, William Segar was also a noted portrait painter to the late Elizabethan elite. Segar’s sitters included Leicester, Essex, and Queen Elizabeth, among others, and the fees he commanded for the portraits he painted were considerably higher than those of other leading court artists of the day; see Goldring, Robert Dudley, Earl of Leicester, and the World of Elizabethan Art, 143–53, 163–64
